body:
Comment 4: 
Note that the memhash code is only used on older x86 chips (newer ones use aeshash) so
this particular example doesn't need to be fixed.  It's a more general critique of the
code generated by 6c.

We could rewrite some of runtime into go, but probably not all of it.  Maybe we could
change 6c to use the backend of 6g?  (I had thought they used the same backend, but
Dmitry's example makes me think maybe not.)
